title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5600.4 - Appeal from denial of access to records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5600.4 - Appeal from denial of access to records

State Regulations
(a) Any person who is denied access to any
record may, within 30 days of such denial, appeal the denial in writing to the
general counsel of the corporation. (b) The time for deciding an appeal shall
commence upon receipt of a written appeal identifying: (1)
the date of the request for
records; (2)
the records that were
denied; and
(3)
the name and return
address of the applicant. (c) The general counsel shall inform the
appellant and the Committee on Public Access to Records in writing of the
corporation's determination within seven business days of an
appeal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5600.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
